item.title: Reflections on Retros
item.description: I have a beef with Scrum Retrospectives when we create actions without owners, avoid difficult conversations, and don’t see changes over time. The format does not get outcomes for me, but it seems true for those operating at Senior levels or above. I prefer to take proactive steps adjust the team environment. I do this by taking action and directly talking to stakeholders. That could mean include engaging delivery managers, creating Architectural Decision Records to align on a technical implementation, or promoting best practice through pairing.
